revised_title: Characteristics and Origin of Electric Earth-Current Disturbances
tldr: The author investigates earth-current disturbances and their connection to atmospheric ionization, particularly during auroral displays. They identify five types of characteristic noises produced by these disturbances and suggest that they are related to the interaction between electric stresses in the atmosphere and solar radiation-induced ionization. The author also proposes that these disturbances may be linked to diurnal variations in the Earth's magnetic field and the efficiency of wireless telegraphy at night.
